body:
Thanks for the detailed report, `Assertions.setRemoveAssertJRelatedElementsFromStackTrace(false)` is a good step to make sure AssertJ does not truncate the stack trace.
I'll try to reproduce the issue in eclipse to see if this IDE specific or not.

the issue relates to https://github.com/assertj/assertj-core/issues/2067, when building the `AssertJMultipleFailuresError` message we build a summary of all the underlying errors [but not their stacktrace](https://github.com/assertj/assertj-core/blob/09203199cf81e6482f8bab8d51f383ba1b207e92/src/main/java/org/assertj/core/error/AssertJMultipleFailuresError.java#L51), so what you get is only the `AssertJMultipleFailuresError` stack trace (which points to the `satisfies` call).

https://github.com/assertj/assertj-core/issues/2067 is going to address that by keeping the first lines of the the underlying errors stack traces.
@perlun  I'm closing this issue in favor of https://github.com/assertj/assertj-core/issues/2067 but feel free to continue commenting on it if you feel this is not the best solution.

@joel-costigliola Thanks for the effort, appreciated! We don't use the multi-lambda with `.satisfies()` at the moment, and given that we have a number of assertions in these lambdas (17 in our local example I'm looking at for the moment), I'm not sure if it would be a great fit (and I'm not even sure if's required or if the fix for #2067 will help in our kind of use case as well?). But, I'm willing to give it a try.

Let me know once 3.23 has been released and I can test with our code base. :+1: Again, thanks for looking into this.
we aim to release 3.23.0 at the end of month but in software development there are "sometimes" delays :smile: .

issue.title: `satisfiesOnlyOnce` stack trace does not point to failed nested assertion

repository.name: assertj
repository.description: Fluent testing assertions for Java and the JVM

body: @upsidedownsmile it seems to be a separate issue of `satisfiesOnlyOnce` so I raised #3480.

@scordio thanks for creating a new issue, I thought it was related with this one.  
I'll take a look at https://github.com/assertj/assertj/issues/3480 to know when it will be solved.

I'm still having this issue with `.satisfiesExactly` in 3.26.3. I lose the information in the stacktrace of which nested `assertThat` failed. `setRemoveAssertJRelatedElementsFromStackTrace(false)` doesn't help.
Hi @bbottema, could you please share a small reproducer?
